Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Barca4Ever
Reviews.Content: The location, just 100 meter from Leidseplain and Hard Rock Cafe is alone worht the value. But the noise from the trams ringing their bells early in the morning woke me up every morning. But maybe that is what i have to expect to stay at a hotel close to centrum. Amsterdams most fasionable stors are located in the same street. Louis Vuitton, Prada and Boss stores is just 50 meter from the hotel. The biggest museums in Amsterdam, such as Reijksmuseum (Rembrandt) is also a 2 minutes walk from the hotel. PS! Try the small Indonesian bar/restaurant on the other side of the hotels main entrance. But book a table early, they are fullbooked early every day. The only thing i missed was a coffemachine. We stayed at room 404, and it was a regular hotel room, with very good beds. The staff was very helpful and gave us some good tips about how to be a tourist in Amsterdam. I wil return to the hotel later this year. :-)

Reviews.Title: “They could offer a much better service”
Reviews.Author: Dina N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location , people at the reception were slow , the small double room are extremely small , but yet beds are comfy

Reviews.Title: “Free WIFI, good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sjaak S
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in ROBERTRAMON, the location was really great, i visit Amsterdam for its museums and they were all around the corner, they even sell entrance tickets at the reception, with this we didnâ€™t need to stand in line. Reception lady was kind, our rooms was good, exactly how the describe it on the net, clean and comfortable beds. I ordered coffee and tea facilities in the room and this was good and plenty of coffee an tea. We used Breakfast only the last day, but was good, and not expensive for a hotel breakfast, only 9.50 euro. The Hotel is modern and dark decorated. Free WIFI was working very good, they have a very nice roof terrace next to the lobby, which was on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: PirateCutiee
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Amsterdam. We chose hotel ROBERTRAMON because it was near all the museums and also from the leidsesquare. When we arrived there was a friendly receptionist welcoming us. Because we were to early we could not check in yet, but we could leave our luggage. She gave us a citymap and showed us all the must see places. We went to the Van Gogh and when we returned our room was ready. The room is very simple but yet everything is there what you need. Hairdryers are at the front desK an you can have coffee and thea facillities at a small price. We stayed for 3 nights and upon check in they have a good deal for 9,50 per person per day for a buffet breakfast. They have free wifi and the staff is always helpfull with all the qustions we had. This trip and hotel was worth my money. I will come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, will definitly stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie M
Reviews.Content: I spent just 2 nights in Amsterdam (02/04/12-04/04/12) whilst visiting family who live just 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. I spent a long time searching websites for hotels that were within my price range, and found it hard to find one that was a single room as opposed to sharing a dormatory with 8 people, and one that had its own toilet not a shared one. I was in room 210, a single room with en-suite shower and toilet. I booked directly through the hotels website and also got 10% by doing so. Before I went, I read the reviews on different sites for the hotel, and the main negative points were that the rooms where small and dark. This was true, the room was dark and quite small. However, when in Amsterdam, you dont spend all day in your hotel room and it was prefectly adequate in size to be able to keep your luggage in (some places charge extra to store your luggage as you cannot fit the bags in the room in Amsterdam). The other negatives I saw on here were that the flatscreen TV was tiny. This is also true, but who cares? They had about 36 channels, a mix of Dutch and English channels, what more do you want! Again, you dont go to Amsterdam to spend hours watching TV surely? My room was clean and tidy, lovely fresh and clean bedding. I had my bedding and towels changed even thought I was only there for 2 nights! The staff were friendly and spoke good English which made it easy to check in and out of the hotel. The hotel is in a fantastic location. Right next to VondelPark, and a 3-4 minute walk from the Leidseplein and PC Hoofstraat is known to be the most expensive shopping street in Amsterdam! On an evening around 22.00hrs I walked back from Kerkstraat (central) to the hotel approxiamtely 5 minutes walk, and I felt very safe which was brilliant as I was travelling alone (female). I am returning to Amsterdam shotly to visit family, and I will definitly be staying in the Hotel RoberRamon again. I have also recommended this hotel to my other family members!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: hummer1829
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 306 for one night at 82.73 Euros in October 2011. The following are my notes: 1) Fairly easy hotel to find once you have your bearings in Amsterdam. I got lost trying to get here from Centraal train station. I just arrived from Paris and did not realize that Amsterdam is a fairly small city in comparison. 2) Good access to tram that connects to rest of Amsterdam. It is about a half block from the hotel door. Ask front desk for map and directions. Keep in mind that after midnight it becomes a bus service and not the tram. 3) Wifi worked really well in the room. No problem using the facebook chat option to communicate with family in Canada. 4) Room is probably small for North American standards at that price point, but was more than large enough for me (traveling solo). Room had two beds, a television, desk and was actually quite spacious. Bathroom was decent, although the mirror is mounted too high. I am about 5'5" and could not see the mirror standing in my bare feet. The Dutch really are the tallest people on earth! 5) Close to higher end shopping area. Literally across the main street where the tram travels on. 6) Hotel allowed me to store my belongings after I had checked out. Lobby/reservation area was small but was adequate for its purpose. Staff spoke English. 7) There was no where within a block or two to have food at night. However, for a less than 5-7 minute walk, food could be found. Overall, a good hotel to stay that does not break the bank but is well above a hostel (nothing against hostels).

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Modern & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: scotteach
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were given two rooms on the top floor, a twin and a single facing the front street. On first inspection, the rooms seemed very small but simply furnished with modern bathrooms, small tv and free wifi that worked very well. We were three girls and it also felt very safe, you had to use your room key to enter the front door at night. It was fairly quiet, although you could here some street noise but not enough to keep you awake. We had breakfast one morning that we felt was Excellent value at 9.50 euros if booked the night before. It was fresh, varied and yummy. The 197 bus goes right from the airport to the hotel, and trams are also close by to get to dam square in 5 min. We tried the Italian close by for dinner which was good for a cheap dinner. You are right next to the rijksmuseum, museumplein, house of bols cocktail experience, van gogh. 3 min walk to hard rock cafe and canal boats. Try r & r for delicious and healthy sandwiches. cafe American is a grand place to eat or take coffee and is on the way to the leidesplein square of restaurants and bars. The park is also very close. The hop on hop off bus is good to do on the first morning and stops around the corner and Anne franks house is also worth a visit. The 9 streets area and the jordaan were beautiful areas to wander through with small shops and cafe. The red light district was a spectacle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very small & dark rooms!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeBoateng
Reviews.Content: Booked a trip room which was a small twin room with another bed in it. The entrance (as well as the photo's) to the hotel gives the impression of the place being fairly modern, but once inside its really just had a lick of paint and some false (black painted office panel) ceilings inserted. The staff were helpful and very friendly ... the location was excellent, especially as it was -6 and we didn't really want to walk far which is a major plus for this hotel. From what I could see, the hotel didn't have any facilities ... a vending machine in the soulless 'lobby' (an uninviting room with a few chairs in it) where drinks of water and coke were 2 euro's a can. The room was very cramped and had one single halogen light in the ceiling, presumably to save on electricity. There was also two small lamps, one of which didn't work. There was no iron so I borrowed one from reception ... the ironing board in the room was as much use as a chocolate teapot being about 50cm long with legs about 10cm which wouldn't enable it to stand up. I would have been fine for a midget or as a childs toy ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable hotel but take a torch!”
Reviews.Author: mad194
Reviews.Content: Three of us shared a room in this hotel for two nights in January. First of all, the location is fantastic, close to the Rijksmuseum and the Leidensplein (for food & drink) and on the Amsterdam equivalent of Bond Street. We took the train from the airport to Amsterdam Zuid (2.50 Euros from the machine, 10 minutes) and then the 5 tram, direction Amsterdam Centraal, 7 stops (we had bought 48 hour tram passes from the tourist information in the airport). Checking in was fine, the receptionist had a good sense of humour and all the staff there seemed friendly and very helpful. The stairs are horrendously steep but there is a lift. Our room was a triple, basically it was a room with three beds in it (and a TV on the wall, we never did find the remote control). It had dark walls, a black carpet, black curtains and black bed covers. And one inset bulb in the ceiling and two bedside lamps. I had to get out my pocket torch to read the instructions for the safe, not that I ever got it to work. If any of us had dropped a black thing (like a sock) we would probably never have seen it again, it was rather depressing. The beds were comfortable, the room was warm, the hot water was scorching. Unfortunately the other hotel guests were not considerate, we were woken both nights by other guests either going to bed in the early hours or, on the second morning just before 6am, what sounded like some kind of tour group jog around the second and third floors of the hotel. Not the hotelÂ´s fault of course. We didnÂ´t have breakfast, on the internet it had been offered to us at 15 euros a head a night and so we thought we could do better. When we arrived at the hotel, we were offered it at 9.50 euros a head. We were able to buy a bagel and coffee around the corner for around 6 euros. The reception is staffed 24 hours a day and there is a luggage room to store your luggage the day you leave. I would recommend this hotel, its very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ReneKruger
Reviews.Content: Loved the interior of the hotel. Rooms are really a sufficient size. Bigger than expected. Quite hotel overall. Hotel very clean. Rooms a bit dark, maybe some lights to do one's make-up will do. The staff are extreamly helpful and friendly. It was really very good value for money. Only one tram stop away from Leidsplein. Near enough for one to go back during the day to take back you shopping and take a quick shower. Our tv worked for one day, we reported the problem, they sorted it out, and the next 2 days we had the same problem with the tv. But it was not the end of the world. We could at least listen to a music channel. I would any day book at this hotel again. And already planning on doing so for my next trip this year (2012). Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but overall nice”
Reviews.Author: Dan81nz
Reviews.Content: Room was small for 2 people, but was clean and tidy. Hotel is close to tram line and in a nice area of town. We were staying on the top floor and the wifi reception was not very good up there, kept cutting out. Overall enjoyed staying here though. Reception was helpful, I asked if there was an internet cafe nearby as I needed to print a document and they offered to print it for me which was nice. Hotel has a vending machine for drinks

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: ecd3007
Reviews.Content: very small rooms compact ... extremely noisy though but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: danpedersen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night during a business trip in Amsterdam. My single room: - Small - Too dark (bring a flashlight) - Bed not that comfortable. Breakfast was OK with most of the expected food items. Location is excellent. It is situated on the P.C. Hoofstraat shopping Street. Within walking distance from Rijksmuseum, Leidse Square and Vondel Park. For shorter stays this is an OK hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: klt186338
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Sep. Had a twin room facing the street on the 2nd floor. Yes the rooms are small and walls are thin but it does what it says on the tin. Room was clean, bathroom was small, but clean, and had everything you need (shower with hot water, towels, soap dispenser). On the first floor there is a lounge with some sofas and a table and 1 computer with free internet and a vending machine that sells soft drinks and heineken for 2.50 Euro. There's pretty much nothing to do at the hotel (didn't bother with the breakfast) but that doesn't matter, not when you've got the whole of amsterdam on your doorstep! Rijksmuseum was a stone throw away and Van Gogh Museum is no more than a 5 min walk. Leidsplein is a 5min walk in the other direction, full of bars, restaurants, coffee shops etc. You can get tram 2 or 5 to centraal station or walk it in under half hour. Or from the airport you can get bus 197 for 4.60 Euro and it takes you to museumplein, from there its a 2 min walk. Overall had a great stay in Dam! I wanted a nice room with a comfy bed to sleep in, a bathroom i didnt have to share, running hot water, full length mirror, tv (only 15" btw) wardrobe and a safe.... and that is what i got! Cant complain seeing as we searched by 'price' rather than 'popularity' or 'rating'. Only 'surprise' was that we were under the impression we had paid for the room when booking only to be presented with an invoice upon arrival (with added city tax!) turns out we didnt pay for the room they just temporaily put the money into a holding account to ensure we had the funds.... so we had to pay for the room when we got there (which we hadnt budgeted for) was our own mistake for not checking transactions but still worth pointing out.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmoane
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a simple, safe and comfortable hotel to stay at in Amsterdam. Some friends recommended the RobertRamon hotel, located in the Museum district. This is a small and simple hotel. Our room was small but had almost all we needed, we had to take our own hair dryer though.The beds were surprisingly comfortable. We did not want to spend too much money and this was the perfect choice. The neighborhood is very chic and it is only a couple of blocks away from the Van Gogh and Rijks museums. I almost forgot to mention that the desk workers were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: joao p
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, my staying at R&R did not go as well as i wished or planned. On the first day, I went to the bathroom I could not stop noticing some irregularities. The shower courtin was with mold/mildow, the shower gel was empty and worst of all, the sink was with broken glasses. It did not make feel comfortable at all... I summited my complaint to Mr. Elmer Groenewould (Manager) He replied to me saying that " My collegue informed me this evening that your shower curtain was replaced and your bathroom inspected. I hope, that after this, it was to your satisfaction." However, the situation was not resolved. My shower curtain was not replaced. Actually, i did not have any courtin at all. Besides that, i also had a craked glass. Mr Elmer did not even bother to apologize or reply to my e-mails.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the RobertRamon”
Reviews.Author: pamelaida
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RobertRamon for two nights while in Amsterdam. It was extremely convenient. The room was immaculate. The desk workers were very nice and assisted with directions and taxis. This is walking distance to the best museums and the tram. It is also down the block from the best shopping are of Amsterdam and excellent restaurants. The price was high but it was peak vacation season. The room was small but did offer free Internet access. Breakfast was not included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MizunguhowRU?
Reviews.Content: Got booked in here at the last minute due to a reservation mess-up by another hotel. The rate (90 euro) from a last minute web site was quite reasonable for Amsterdam. My single room was very very small but clean and comfortable. No AC here but unless you come through Amsterdam in late July or a few days in August you won't miss it. I come through Amsterdam on business frequently and can tell you that customer service is not a big part of the culture here. The staff I dealt with here were a welcome exception, extremely pleasant and even a bit outgoing. The best thing this hotel has going for it is it's location. Easily accessible by tram from the central station it is an easy walk to one of Amsterdam's high end shopping streets and the Museumplein area with its Museums and diamond dealers. Walk in the opposite direction and you can get to the Leidseplein areas with its funky night life and large selection of bars restaurants and cafes. Not luxurious but almost any other hotel in this part of town will cost a lot more and not offer much for the premium.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed in this hotel , and had items stolen”
Reviews.Author: parisa10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel , and left an necklace there the cleaners stole it when cleaned the room , when I rang up hotel took receptionist over an hour check room , came back and said cleaners already been in not there

Reviews.Title: “Nice neat rooms but don't stay there during hot seasons!!”
Reviews.Author: Dottswack
Reviews.Content: The location is considered good as it is near to Van Gogh & Rijks museum. Not to memtion very close to Vondelpark, Hard Rock Cafe and river cruise station. However, there's much to be desired on the rooms' side. It is undoubtedly clean but very, very basic and there is no air conditioning system or even a fan. The windows can't be open widely as it is the bottom lever type. There was only about 3 inches of space for natural air or wind to come in. It was sooo hot when i was there that we couldn't stay in the room in the day time. When we come back at night, it is still stuffy and warm. This is too bad as the other aspects of the hotel is not too bad. Although a little bit too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Compact & Bijou!”
Reviews.Author: Batti66
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 11 celebrating a 50th birthday. As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are very small and our room had no drawers and a minute wardrobe with only 5 hangers, so we lived out of our suitcase. All rooms are twins and because of the size of the rooms, they are virtually doubles because they are so close to each other! The bathroom was also tiny but functional. Couldn't complain about our bathroom - it was clean and the shower as good and hot - but others in our group had problems with a very bad sewage smell and one couple was moved. The hotel did sort out the problem for the other couple and they stayed where they were. You have to pay 7.50 Euros per day if you want tea and coffee making facilities brought to your room. There is no bar; only a small lobby area with a drinks vending machine (soft drinks and lager). The dining room is small and in the basement (serves breakfast only). We had breakfast included in our rate but it isn't worth it really, unless you like lots of bread and jam or cold ham and cheese. There is a very limited choice of cereals, yoghurts and fruit juices but I would personally recommend you go out to eat and use the money you save on not paying the breakfast rate on a decent breakfast elsewhere. The hotel has been decorated in a modernistic style and is quite dark (carpets, ceiling, bedding). If you suffer with poor eyesight in the evening and want to read in bed, I'd recommend taking a torch! The hotel is in a nice area, within easy walking distance of the Rijksmuseum and Leidesplein Square, and some upmarket shops. It is easy to get around on trams from here and only a short walk to grab a canal boat tour or hire bikes. Also within walking distance is the Bols liqueur factory and the Heineken factory. This hotel is OK if you're only using it to sleep in. You can't eat or drink here (except the continental breakfast or the drinks vending machine). There is a lift but this hotel would be useless for anyone disabled.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the bad reviews about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ant020281
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a quiet good location in a very nice district of Amsterdam. We read alot of reviews about small rooms and we did not pay alot for our stay so was expecting the worst. There were 9 people in our group with four room and all were of a fairly good size, more than enough space. There was also a very good comunal area for relaxing in or pre going out drinks. The only bad point was that the staff could have been a bit more friendlier but would deffinatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and thats that”
Reviews.Author: vindoc2000
Reviews.Content: Very bad experience in this Hotel. The rooms were match boxes. Very very overpriced. The breakfast was very poor for 300 euros a night. Very disappointed. The staff were very friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, noisy hotel - Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: cbeartraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at RobertRamon for three days in September 2010. The hotel was located near a few popular museums and within walking distance to a few restaurants...but the price and overall hotel experience is not worth this location. Amsterdam is a small city and you can walk to everything easily (or take public transportation). The hotel is not very sound proof - I could hear trams running, cars driving on the street, and people talking on the street all night long. I could also hear other people in other hotel rooms talking and walking around their room. On my first day at the hotel, I was waiting to talk with the receptionist while he was helping another person. Thee receptionist created a hotel card key for my room for this person. I only caught this because I was standing at the reception desk and the receptionist said here is a key for room 312 as the people were walking, I pointed out to the receptionist that room 312 was my room...the receptionist called back the people and made them a different key. Not sure what would have happened if I would not have been standing at the reception desk. I would not stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience.”
Reviews.Author: jd999
Reviews.Content: A totally average hotel experience, all things considered. While it was very clean it was also very cramped. While it was centrally located, it was located near museums and on an expensive shopping street. An hotel on the canals would of course have captured at least some of the essential Amsterdam atmosphere that is found so easily in so many places around the city. The staff were really helpful but all in all, this is an hotel that one would use purely as a dormitory. There is no point in returning to the premises during the day. The best eating, drinking and canal gazing experiences are to be had at least 10 - 15 minutes walk away. Overall, at about 50 Euro each per night for a very cramped triple room it was quite average. You might do better.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FEW STEPS AWAY FROM MUSEUMPLEIN AND OTHER ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: EffieAthens_Greece
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel ,EXCELLENT breakfast! TRAM 2 and 5 nearby (very convinient for our transportations). Our room was clean and spacious, the matresses though were a bit small. This was a problem for the first two or three days, then we got used to it (as we stayed there for seven nights!). Very fashionable and sylish brand name shops around the hotel. P.C. HOOFSTRAT is one of the most expensive shoping streets in Amsterdam. We are planning to visit Amsterdam on APRIL 2011 for two weeks this time and we will try to book a room in ROBERTRAMON!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny, tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: gennari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 days in Amsterdam and the hotel met our expectations regarding the location. It is reaaly very well located, walking distance from the main attactions, near a bus stop (just accross the street). The staff is helpfull. There was a problem with our shower and it took an hour form them to provide us with another room, and in this first room we have already realized how tiny it was but when you get to the new one it was more than tiny, I can not even say! There was no space for a telephone device, can imagine that? But, if you are most interested in good location, this is the place to stay, it will worth you money. The pictures I have attached are from the first room "much, much bigger" than the second one

Reviews.Title: “At last a peaceful nice hotel in Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: GirlFromMay
Reviews.Content: ... and not too expensive either (given the average cost in this city). Very well located, near many attractions and shops, VERY QUIET, helpful staff (even a bit too much to my taste), the room was small but neat, and decoration is original and lovely, and there's a lift (which is pretty rare in Amsterdam). Reception 24/24, free wifi. For me the bad point : enterely no smoking, but it's a law in the Netherlands and very few hotels derogate.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackyK
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful Hotel in the PC Hooftstraat in Amsterdam near the Vondelpark and the shopping area in the centre. The hotelservice was lovely for a 3* Hotel. Also a good breakfast and a good room. I like my stay there and will come back in the summer. there is a parking service which is cheaper than parking in the street. Wireless internet is available. It is a non-smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, false advertisement”
Reviews.Author: fede123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and the Robert Ramon is the most overpriced I have ever been in. I went to Amsterdam with 2 friends. We reserved a triple room for 180 euros a night. The first thing that struck me was the sign outside the hotel with the official 3 star rating. The website clearly says it is a 4 star hotel. The lobby was very bland and plain. The elevator was not working. The room was the real kicker though. Their idea of a triple room is a single with 3 small beds. The third bed awkwardly placed without even a lamp on the bedside. The flat screen tv mentioned on the website is in fact a very small and cheap tv (Im including a picture). There were no cupboards or dressers to fit the clothes of 3 people. I complained to the receptionist and wanted to cancel my stay. Conveniently, the Robert Ramon charges for your full stay as soon as you check in. No wonder... they probably have to deal with a lot of clients who want their money back. I was told that I would not be able to get a refund for the first day as there is a 48 hour cancellation policy. I asked for a better rate for the second night and was told that when I booked I knew what the rooms looked like from the website. The rooms look nothing like in the website, never mind the false advertisement claiming it is a 4 star hotel. I go to Amsterdam often, I know the price of hotel rooms there; 180 euros goes a long way. I was ripped off. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Piet Hein, just 2 blocks away from the Robert Ramon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MissPiggy76
Reviews.Content: If location, location, location is what you are looking for in Amsterdam then the Hotel RobertRamon is the hotel for you. It's located on PC (Pieter Cornelisz) Hooftstratt - an elegant and unique shopping street. It's within walking distance of all the main tourist locations - the Rijksmuseum is a stones throw from the building! Okay this is not a 4* or 5* hotel but it does not claim to be. It is a 3* hotel. We've just returned from a 3 night mini-break, and it was more than adequate for the 237 euros we paid for a twin room. The lobby is small but the reception staff were very helpful. There is a lounge on the first floor with seating, drinks vending machines (including Heineken), and a computer with FREE internet access. Our room 403 even though relatively small was spotlessly clean (maid service every day). Tea & coffee are NOT provided in the room but you can get a daily supply for 7.50 euros - or in our case we knew about this this and took our own travel kettle! An iron and hairdryer is not in the room but if you ring recption they can provide you with them. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel - initially we thought 12.50 euros was a little pricey but after eating breakfast out each morning this is actually a good price. To get to the hotel using public transport is really easy - it costs 4.20 euros to get from the Airport to Amsterdam Centraal, and then a no 2 or 5 tram can be picked up from outside the station to the Rijksmuseum for 3.20 euros. I believe you can get a transfer from the hotel to the airport by taxi for 40 euros but the public transport was so easy to use. Allow up to an hour when using tram/train. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel RobertRamon but like many countries in the euro it's expensive eating and drinking out but would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “is this an hotel?”
Reviews.Author: thecriticexplorer
Reviews.Content: this is the perfect example of "you dont get what you see"...if you look at their website the hotel seems very fancy,( even if there are some signs of the lack of their seriousness in the way their website is vague about every relevant details ) but once you get to Amsterdam ..surprise! First of all its a 3 stars hotel ( a bad one) not 4 as the hotel rate itself on the website. Rooms are extremely small, the deco is very average. No mini bar, no hair dryer , no phone, mini tv ( in dutch only) , no shampoo/soap/toothbrush+paste ...dont even expect the basics! They dont even change your sheets daily!!!! Staff very rude, not helpful at all, one day we arrived in the room and instead of finding our steam room temperature we found ourselves in Siberia ....the smart maid turned off the heather and left the window open ... the very helpful receptionist look at me and my friend like we were 2 idiot and didn t even offers us another room or at least a hot tea!! The day before the water was down for maintenance from 10am till 5pm. Wifi doesn t work! THe day we checked out we were woke up by "someone" knocking an yelling like a hyena at our door saying we had to leave the room asap (it was 11am) ....overall the worst experience in the most ridiculous "hotel" with the most unfriendly and dumb stuff The owner should have kept doing his 2 rooms only B&B business. Only good thing is the location which is close to the museum district in a very quiet area

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: marquito_9
Reviews.Content: first time to Amsterdam and stayed at Hotel Robertramon. From the first step in to the hotel there was a warm welcome from all the stay. the room was great, modernly decorated and wireless internet for free!. Looking at the reviews before our stay we saw comments about noise from the street. I must say this is nothing special compared with other placed i stayed in. Overall very good, location perfect and friendly staff with a smile. certainly going back !

Reviews.Title: “be warned”
Reviews.Author: rubyStokeOnTrent
Reviews.Content: we read reviews on this hotel where people had turned up and their reservaton had been double booked or cancelled ,and believed this to be just one of those mistakes that rarely happens, however it happened to us .we initally booked a very cheap room with this hotel to turn up and find out they had cancelled are room without telling us. the staff were extremely rude and arrogant they did find us another room in a different hotel .,the museum hotel which was much better with friendly helpful staff. needlessly to say i would never entertain staying at the robert ramon, be warned dont take reviews as people having the odd random bad experience we made that mistake

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ramby09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money and it had a perfect central location. Just around the corner from the Heineken Experience & the Van Gogh gallery. We walked everywhere but there was also a Tram stop right outside the hotel which went to all the main attractions. Staff were very helpful. Went through the map with us without us asking them. Breakfast was continental & very nice. One morning we got down to breakfast late and all the croissants were gone but the cook came out of the kitchen & offered to make some up fresh even though I hadn't asked. The rooms were clean but not very big. The only downside was that you could not sleep in as the rooms are near a busy street. However this did not bother me personally as the room is only for sleeping in. I would recommend this hotel to friends and would return again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi Rubbish, great if you like a sauna”
Reviews.Author: vivaGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you are used to warmer climates and tiny single rooms, single room was so small i thought i was in a cupboard, but it was great as I needed to lose aq few pounds and it had no air condictioning thus was about 100.F at all times, you could open the small window and listen to the street noise or workman below, very handy if you are deaf. may also be good for sailors as bed was on a slope and rolled about, thus like being on a ship. Come to think of it, best way to describe a single room is sleeping in hot engine room to an old steam ship in a storm. wifi works if wind in the correct direction for periods of 5 seconds in every hour. sorry almost forgot about breakfast, you need to go down the steepest stairs (like a ladder) to the basement where you will wished you had not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJetSet
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel excellent and quite frankly you get what you pay for in any european city. We also had breakfast included in our room price which was fine. Good selection and perfect for the short stay visitor. The location is good if you don't want to be in the throng of things. It's very near all the museums and is in a more upmarket district than those further down towards the dam square etc. Nice little cafes and excellent restaurants nearby. Good safe neighbourhood and within easy walking distance of anywhere in the dam. Right next to the tram stop also and perfect for drinks in the Leidesplein area. The room was okay, big windows out on to the front street. Bathroom not brilliant but workable and plenty of room for luggage. No hairdryers for the ladies so beware and take your own. Good sized twin beds in the double room and cleaned every day. Basically you only ever use your room to sleep and revisit to change clothes in any city so it was perfect for that. It looks exactly like it does in the pictures with the fancy minimalist reception area too. The only downside, if I can squeeze one out, is that the shop underneath the hotel is being renovated therefore there was rather loud banging on Saturday morning, but of course in any city you're not there to lie in bed so it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: littleprincess
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights mid week Jan 20-21st, got a good last minute price from easy to book. We were pleasantly surprised by the location. Right near the museums and upmarket stores, also some chic little bars nearby. It is really close from the tram stop, 1-2 min's walk max. It has been well refurbished, decor is good, has a boutique feel. The negative things to mention are mainly to do with noise. You can hear next door through walls, I was woken 4am by next door getting jiggy, this was soon resolved by hotel reception, they gave us earplugs (so I guess this a regular complaint). After that I didn't hear a thing. Building opposite is also getting refurb so builders are working from early am (again wasn't an issue when we had the earplugs in but thought it only fair to mention). Obviously this will be a short term issue. The hotel is clean, the bed was comfortable with nice plump pillows and crisp white linen. Our bathroom was not like the one on the website pictures, a lot more basic but clean. All in all not a bad hotel in a good location, would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little boutique hotel in quiet yet chic location”
Reviews.Author: djedei
Reviews.Content: Very cute little hotel close to the Liedseplein nightlife district and Museumplein museums (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum). Excellent value for the money, had a charming little single room on the top floor. Only critique: Their shower tiling runs right into the main bathroom with no divider, causing water to run all over the bathroom floor during showering. But they seem to have opened recently so I think this is a minor and easily correctible oversight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel needs improvment !!!”
Reviews.Author: sushi33
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 3 minutes walk to RijksMuseum and VanGogh Museum, and shopping street. Hotel has been renovated since 6 months but big deception for paying a room at discount price of Euro 255 .- Reception very small, and often without any staff. Room really small, may be 12 sqm. All rooms on the 4th floor were of the same size. No AirConditionned . No Minibar. Very small bathroom. Tiny LCD TV. Internet working poorly. Breakfast on the lower floor, with only access by very steep stairs. Hotel a little noisy at night as facing a pub. Hotel is 3 minutes walk from CANAL BOAT stop. 3 Different boat lines (Red, Blue and Green lines). All the 3 lines are great and worth doing Very convenient to visit Amsterdam, on a get in /get out basis. Boat tickets valid on day of purchase until next day 12am. Much better to visit than the touristic boat tour leaving near train station. Great place to eat Chinese Cantonese food is ORIENTAL CITY 3 floor restaurant, near Dam Square. Restaurant is always packed but worth waiting. Great Dim Sum menu, and very efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Clean, Chic, Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: The RobertRamon Hotel is a great value and a nice little hotel in Amsterdam. Previous reviews run to both extremes, but I can certainly recommend this hotel. It is not a 5-star hotel, so do not expect huge rooms or tons of amenities. It is, however, a very nice hotel at a very low price, in an outstanding location. The single room I stayed in was small but very adequate. It was very clean, the bed was very comfortable and the funky black and pink dÃ©cor is a nice break from cookie cutter hotels. Personally I would have avoided the "industrial" toilet paper dispenser and soap dispenser (looks like public restroom) but this is a matter of taste. Do bring your own shampoo if you don't want to use mystery liquid soap for everything. To address issues in previous posts, it would appear that all construction has been completed, the elevator is in perfect working order , the free wi-fi access is excellent and the staff (limited largely to one young person at the desk) are pleasant and helpful. If you are sensitive to noises you will notice them, you can hear just about everything that is going on in adjacent rooms â€“ so light sleepers beware. The shower is also extremely small, so you will stick to the shower curtain quite a bit. It is two minutes walk to the Tram and one of the ritziest shopping streets in Amsterdam. This also means you can take the train from the airport to the Central Station and there get either a number 2 or a number 5 tram which both stop just a few hundred meters from the hotel (saving you lots of money on a cab fare). While you are at the RobertRamon, be sure to eat at the Indonesian restaurant just around the corner: Srikandi, it is well worth a little splurge for a great â€˜Rice Tableâ€™ meal. Stay at a more expensive hotel if you need space and amenities, but this is a great, basic hotel for those who are happy with cozy, clean and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: praha214
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for seven nights mid-July with two friends and had a great experience. The hotel was in a PERFECT location. If you want to spend a lot of time in the Leidseplein area of Museum area (with the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum, etc) and Vondelpark this is the location you want to be in. It's also on a really nice shopping street. It's a 10 or so minute walk from Dam Square, but a nice walk -- no public transportation needed. Honestly, I would not have enjoyed staying any closer to the square. It was much more busy/felt a lot more touristy and it was nice to be so close to everything yet still feel like you had space! The hotel itself is still undergoing construction but not in a way that disturbed us during our stay. Our room had been renovated with nice decor, etc, though our bathroom had not been updated and could have use a refreshing!! The rooms were very clean. The front desk staff were wonderfully helpful and accomodating and offered great suggestions about everything to do with Amsterdam! The only downsides to this hotel are the small rooms (yes, they are very small, but if that is something you can deal with then this is a great place. if you need lots and lots of room, i might sugest elsewhere) and the lack of a full-length mirror. Also I assume all the bathrooms will be updated once the renovations are complete, though honestly our bathroom was not that bad at all. Overall great stay, great place. I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome beds”
Reviews.Author: Gus_and_Jess
Reviews.Content: We booked for 2 nights through a discount hotel website (cant remember which one) and got a good deal. The beds in this place are so comfortable, we slept vey well on the very soft matress. I would rate it a 3 star hotel as it is getting slightly run down. The 2-in-1 shampoo/body soap wasn't a hit with me. The staff are friendly and the location is so central. A 3 min walk to the main centre of food/affordable shopping.... The streets that surround the hotel have designer stores which therefore has people who can afford to shop there. Making it very safe at night, and very pleasant during the day.... Worth mentioning that they provide free internet... We didn't have breakfast there, instead went to Vondle Park to a delightful cafe on both mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jeanclaudeohms
Reviews.Content: This must be the worst hotel I ever stayed in. I am Dutch but live in London and for work, I need to travel to Amsterdam on a very regular basis. The room is indeed extremely small, but I could live with that. It was the street noise (bad insolation), room noise (slamming with doors and windows at 2am-3am) and works at a building next door that started at 7am that was totally unexceptable. It was as if the works were actually happening in my room. I got up from missery and checked-out at 7.45 as I couldn't bare it! I complained at reception and they were aware of all these matters. I received their excuses but that was it. If you want to spend that kind of money, you are far better of to stay in a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel? Certainly not”
Reviews.Author: EllaInTheSky
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice boutique hotel in Amsterdam, and couldn't believe my luck when I saw the excellent rate the RobertRamon was offering. I should have known: there were basically rebuidling the hotel and it was a battle to get to the rooms. The rooms were designed by some famous designers but it was so tiny I had to stay on bed when I opened my suitcase. The shower wasn't a proper one, the walls are like paper (you can actually hear your neighbour talking in his sleep), etc... I won't recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “You don't wanna Use credit card here- "Dangerous!"”
Reviews.Author: amska
Reviews.Content: terrible place but good location though. - this is the only advantage for this hotel if you are museum-lovers... better to pay with your cash; you don't wanna use your credit card here. they might take your money from your credit card while you didn't even noticed. this scary thing really happend to me. i found unknown transaction and that was went through by this hotel. they don't even have full service responsibility on their own mistake. i feel like too scary to use my credit card in Amsterdam now. if you still want to go to this place.... well, then it's up to you. but better watch out what they are doing with your credit card !!!! keep track your all transcations !!! -i didn't get my money back yet =( make sure that you have strong legs with well trained muscles specially when you have heavy luggages. i was so regret myself to book this place when i climbing up(?) the stairs to get to its main entrance. "Too humble place to be called as a hotel." "Do not waste your money in wrong place"

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected-better have a good sense of humor.”
Reviews.Author: Bocaswim
Reviews.Content: Hotel is undergoing major renovations but not to the rooms. They have not been updated in nearly 40 years. A wrecking ball has taken out most of the first floor of the property and you will need to enter the hotel through a scafolding stairwell. Good news the elevator is now working and the rooms are clean but just old. Ours was missing a curtain on one window and was on a very noisy main road. The photos on the website were very misleading and it was not what we expected. Checked out asap.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great staff for this budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Dame
Reviews.Content: Construction and steep stairs proved somewhat problematic, but friendly staff members helped with luggage and were careful to make sure I maneuvered the steep stairs safely. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Excellent location for seeing museums and sights of interests. And the good news? You burn off all the wonderful calories you consume because you get exercise on the Hotel Smit stairs! Great staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bagebby
Reviews.Content: The reason Hotel Smit is still being renovated is because no one is working on it. During the time I was there, nothing happened. Like someone else said, there is trash and stuff all around on the stairways and you have to carry your own bags up the very narrow and steep stairs (I was on the 5th floor). Cornelius was the only staff member at the desk who was nice. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Nic
Reviews.Content: Book the Hotel Smit for two nights in early June 2007. We lasted 1 night. The hotel is quite literally a building site. There are radiators, double glazing panels left lying and workmens equipment on all of the floors. The lift is out of operation and the stairs are quite frankly dangerous. The room was not clean, wallpaper hanging off the walls, carpet disgusting, stunk of stale cigarettes, holes in the ceiling. The bed 'sell by date' had passed '20' years ago. You could clearly hear what the guests were doing next door. Paper thin walls.... To cap this we were badly bitten by an infestation 'fleas' during the night. We ended up 'sleeping' in our clothes on top of the bed because the bed wasn't clean. The hotel needs to be closed and fully refurbished. The location totally misrepresents the appalling quality of this disgusting 'hotel'. Use at your peril....

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing renovation”
Reviews.Author: Asia-traveller-2
Reviews.Content: The website where I booked did not tell me about the extensive renovations going on at the hotel. The entrance is reached via scaffolding steps up to the first floor, entering through a temporary doorway that must once have been a window. The only compensation for entering at this level is that there is one less floor to climb to your room since the lift is out of action. Stairs are narrow and winding, making it difficult, and potentially unsafe, for people with luggage. My single room was very small, about 6m x 2m. The furnishings were old and the shower room smelled badly. Workmen were noisily working in the room opposite me and the corridor was cluttered with building materials. While the renovated rooms looked fresher and more modern, they were still small. Once renovations are finished the hotel might deserve a higher rating but I would certainly not recommend this hotel while it is undergoing such extensive work - indeed, I feel that it should have been closed down during this work. Despite the hotel undergoing extensive work to the inconvenience of guests, there appeared to be no discount on the normal book price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: her_on_holiday
Reviews.Content: I took a last minute trip to Amsterdam and chose this hotel as it was one of the few to have rooms available at a decent rate in a good area. The location is brilliant - easy to get to from central station on the tram and very close to the Van Gogh museum and Rijksmuseum in one of the nicest parts of the city - something I appreciated as a single female traveller. The hotel does look terrible from the outside at the moment as it is covered in scaffolding and nets, and you have to access it via scaffolding steps at the side, but inside the room was fine. Be warned though - I checked in at 11am (the stated check in time) and was given a key to a room that had not yet been cleaned, though this was quickly rectified by friendly, efficient staff. The room (once done) was clean and comfortable for the price, and was quiet at night. Unfortunately it is not the best choice if you plan on spending any time in the room during the day. I attempted an afternoon nap but was disturbed by the builders knocking windows out in the room above, and felt the need to have the curtains closed as the builders were walking past my window all the time. All in all though, it is a nice little hotel and a bargain at the moment if you are prepared to put up with the renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure your legs work good.”
Reviews.Author: Lubricant
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was good. Hardboiled eggs.. Bread, meats, cheese.. Coffee, tea, OJ.. unlimited. Butter jelly.. cereal and milk.. The bathroom was freshly renovated in room 403, but it smelled a lot, and there was no shower curtain, so the place got soaked every shower. There was a tub, shower, toilet, sink, and mirror. Maid service was good and room was clean. Room had 2 twin beds pushed together. TV service was 31 chan's. mtv, etc.. 5 english. BBC news. Room on 4th floor, no elevator working made it a little difficult to go back to my room as often as I would have liked to. There was a big crack in the wall.

Reviews.Title: “would stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: travellingfarmgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel smit on March 1st, 2007. Despite the hotel being under construction and therefore scaffolding hiding the (making the door hard to find) the room was fine and I enjoyed my stay. The lift was out due to the reno's so I had to lug my luggage up crazy steep stairs but the room was clean and warm and enough room for me and my big suitcase! I had a single room on the second floor which is designated smoking, so the hallway stunk of smoke (of various origins) but the room was just fine (and I am sensitive to smoke smell!) There was a tv in the room with usual dutch channels and BBC and CNN which was nice. The bathroom was clean and typical european, a shower nozzle sticking out of the one side so the whole bathroom got wet whilst showering. This is not a 5 star hotel so do not expect 5 star north american standards! The breakfast was a fine spread of meat/cheese/bread/cereals/juices/fruits/coffee/tea etc and enough to keep you going until lunch. The chap at the front desk was pleasant and told me where to find a wireless cafe, the van gogh museum and everything else I inquired about. He let me leave my luggage behind the desk for a few hours after check out as well. All in all, this hotel was worth the money I paid (got a good deal on ratestogo.com) and much better than staying in a hostel with my computer and other expensive equipment. The hotel is very close to everything, museums, shopping, restaurants and is located right on a tram line (2 or 5, get off at Hobbemastraat stop) and easy to get everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: margand
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Smit is currently undergoing renovation. The painted boarding around the exterior of the hotel can be a bit off-putting upon arrival. In fact, I had a little difficulty figuring out how to get into the reception area but once I did I was greeted by a friendly and helpful desk staff. I stayed in a single room which was tiny. It had a single bed, a chair, a desk and a tv (wall mounted). The walls seemed a little thin but luckily during my stay the noise was fairly minimal. There was a big window but no view as my room faced the backside of the hotel. That said, I must also say that the room was very clean. The bedding and towels appeared new. The attached bathroom was tastefully renovated though the shower was an open stall with no curtain so the bathroom became kind of soaked when used. The location of this little hotel is ideal for tourism. It is just a few steps from a tram that goes through the center of the city (to central station) and near some fabulous shopping, eating and sightseeing. Several designer stores are just out the door and both the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum are within 5 minutes walk... which will make it easy to be first in line if you fail to buy advance tickets. Given that the Hotel Smit is a clean, friendly, and relatively inexpensive... I would stay here again. Maybe by the time I do the construction will be completed and there will be a nice lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Great Location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Im at the hotel right now,which totally saved us. We booked this other dive hole that had mold, and had to find something else. We came here, price was a bit steep for us, $170 per night for 3 ppl, but we got a great discount, almost 40%. Our room has 3 single beds, TV, phone, really clean shower/bathroom and there is free wireless internet, which is great cause we have 2 laptops. Apparently we get free breakfast tommorow, and other guests said it was really good. 5 stars from me, not a super swanky hotel but great nonetheless, Im a clean freak and the room I got I was impressed with, especially the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “hotel Smit, Never back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible! We came with good will to stay for four days. We payed for Four Days, stayed only one no refund. the staff was a guy in a old t-shirt with a bad attitude. The hallway was cold as well as the room. Breakfast or as they called it, terrible! DonÂ´t make the same mistake. Something is really wrong with this hotel and the staff. If You renovate the Hotel, the staff should try even more to satisfy the guests. I would fire these if they worked for Me!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: werldtravuler
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the previous reviews of Hotel Smit. It's convenience to the museum district is it's only (barely) saving grace. The double bedrooms are two single beds pushed together which is not very couple-friendly. The staff was odd and unenthusiastic. There were ants in the sheets, we were only provided 2 towels for two guests, the shower sprays water all over the bathroom, the hallways are cold, and the street noise is very disruptive. The buffet is NOT as gourmet as it has been described. It is a spread of lunch meats, not very good cheese, some bread, hard boiled eggs, and juice. At least the breakfast was free. I have learned from this experience that 4 or 5 Star is the only way to stay in Europe. If you are going to Amsterdam for the first time, spend the extra cash and stay in a nice boutique hotel along a canal in the Jordaan or off Rembrandt Square. It really makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Smit Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Smit was a fantastic place for us to stay. It's certainly not extra fancy or high class, but it's still clean, convenient, and friendly. Our room wasn't too small, but had a beautiful view of the Rijks Museum! The location is definitely a plus for the Hotel Smit! Less than one block from the Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh Museum. And the street it's located on is full of high-end shopping--Gucci, Prada, Cartier, etc. It's also very near the Hard Rock Cafe, a casino, and other shopping/entertainment. And the best part of the Hotel Smit was the cat that lived in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We headed to a quick visit to Amsterdam and we very pleased with the Hotel Smit. The breakfast buffett that is included with the price of the room was a HUGE budget saver for us. Breaksfast included meats, cheeses, coffee, tea, cold cereal, hardboiled eggs, juice and baguettes -- it filled us up for most of the day! The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and even though we were in a smoking room you never would have noticed -- absolutely no smoke stench. The hotel is located within walking distance of most of the Amsterdam museums and the street were is located is home to some pretty shwanky shopping (Cartier, Hugo Boss, Gucci etc...) but the price of the hotel would never lead you to believe this! We plan to return to Amsterdam and will definitely make our reservation at Hotel Smit again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel RobertRamon
HotelInfo.Address: PC Hooftstraat 24-28, Amsterdam 1017 BX, The Netherlands
